intro: Cerinthe major f. pseudopallida, commonly known as the pale-flowered horned poppy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features striking, spurred flowers that are typically pale yellow to white, with a distinctive horn-like projection at the base of the petals. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands or rocky habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Papaveraceae family.
